quest.name: From a Distance
journal:
 Quest Sync
Anthibert has need of one with your particular qualifications.

dialogue.name: ANTHIBERT
dialogue.text: Pardon me─might you be the Crystal Exarch's esteemed guest? I'd like to borrow your expertise, if you've a moment to spare.

dialogue.name: ANTHIBERT
dialogue.text: There's a boy, you see, who frequents the Cabinet regularly. Like so many of his peers, he has never experienced the world outside the Crystarium. And so he comes here, to catch glimpses of it in the pages of timeworn books...

dialogue.name: ANTHIBERT
dialogue.text: I am certain that what he truly desires is to learn of the living, breathing world, however. The world as it is today, through the eyes of one who has seen it.

dialogue.name: ANTHIBERT
dialogue.text: Might you share your experience with him? I believe you'll find him just up the stairs.

dialogue.name: ANTHIBERT
dialogue.text: The boy will like as not be full of questions─brace yourself.

dialogue.name: BOY03347
dialogue.text: You're from far away!? Then...can you tell me what the world outside is like? Pretty please?

dialogue.name: BOY03347
dialogue.text: Oh! Then... Then... Can you tell me about the animals? There are a lot, right? Father says they're all dangerous, though. Is that true?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Are all wild animals dangerous?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Most are only dangerous if you make them mad.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: They're all dangerous. And scary!

dialogue.name: BOY03347
dialogue.text: Really? Oooh...

dialogue.name: BOY03347
dialogue.text: Aww, you won't tell me?

dialogue.name: BOY03347
dialogue.text: Um... What about what it looks like? Does the whole world look like Lakeland?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Does the rest of the world look the same as Lakeland?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Pretty much. Trees, dirt, whatever.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Some of it is more different than you could ever imagine.

dialogue.name: BOY03347
dialogue.text: Oh... I think I understand.

dialogue.name: BOY03347
dialogue.text: But why won't you tell me?

dialogue.name: BOY03347
dialogue.text: Hmm... Then, what about traveling? Mother says it's not worth it─there's nothing to see out there, and it's too dangerous... But I want to go on adventures! What do you think?

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: Is it worth going on adventures?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: It can be dangerous, but is always worthwhile.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Your mother's right─there's no point to it.

dialogue.name: BOY03347
dialogue.text: Hmm... I see!

dialogue.name: BOY03347
dialogue.text: ...Are you maybe telling me that I should think about it on my own?

dialogue.name: BOY03347
dialogue.text: I'm sure now─I want to see the world! I'm going to study, and...and practice martial arts! Then, when I'm strong and clever, I'll go on an adventure!

dialogue.name: BOY03347
dialogue.text: It does seem pretty dangerous out there, but I still want to know more about the world! And maybe see it for myself someday.

dialogue.name: BOY03347
dialogue.text: I guess there really isn't anything you could tell me that would be the same as seeing it, is there? I need to go out there myself!

dialogue.name: BOY03347
dialogue.text: Thank you for letting me ask questions! And please tell Anthibert that I'm going home─I have a lot of work to do! I wonder if Father will let me practice with his axe...

dialogue.name: ANTHIBERT
dialogue.text: Yes, I saw him dash past, eyes twinkling.

dialogue.name: ANTHIBERT
dialogue.text: I do believe in the magic of the written word. How could I not? But it's not quite the same as meeting someone who has been there─who herselfhimself is part of the wider world.

dialogue.name: ANTHIBERT
dialogue.text: I've never ventured far from the Crystarium myself, you see, so I know the wonder and fascination that comes from hearing the fireside tales of travelers. You have my personal gratitude for sharing a bit of that with our young friend today.
